snippet: After 26 years, the not-by-the-book arrangement Jerry Delakas had for operating his newsstand in the East Village unraveled, but Mayor Bill de Blasio opened the door to a settlement.
abstract: New York City officials reverse course and agree to let controversial newsstand on Astor Place reopen and to grant its longtime operator, Jerry Delakas, the necessary license; newsstand was closed in December, after 26 years of operation, because Delakas did not have the proper license; Mayor Bill de Blasio opened door to settlement.
lead_paragraph: After 26 years, the not-by-the-book arrangement Jerry Delakas had for operating his newsstand in the East Village unraveled, but Mayor Bill de Blasio opened the door to a settlement.

headline.main: Newsstand to Reopen, After de Blasio Helps
headline.print_headline: Newsstand to Reopen, After de Blasio Helps
